item.title: Stéfan Sinclair on "Favourite ways of converting Word HTML to decent HTML"
item.dc:creator: Stéfan Sinclair
item.description:
I'm curious if anyone is particularly pleased with their method of cleaning Word HTML files. There's any number of services based on HTML Tidy, some of which are integrated into editors like TextWrangler and TextMate, but I still find I need to do some further clean up and correction, especially with lists (any tool would need to know specifics about the peculiar way Word exports lists into HTML). Someone mentioned publishing from Word to a blog entry, but I'm not sure if that's possible in Word for Mac.

Any further suggestions (aside from avoiding Word)?
